forageables.recipe: Salad: Mix fresh dandelion leaves with olive oil, lemon juice or vinegar, black pepper, and salt. Add tomatoes, carrots, onions, and other fruits, veggies and herbs to taste.
forageables.name: Dandelion

forageables.recipe: Tea: Steep fresh or dry leaves in hot water for 2-5 minutes to make a tea of desired strength.
forageables.name: Stinging Nettle

forageables.recipe: Jam: Simmer blackberries, lemon juice and water for 1 hour, then strain. Add 1 lb of sugar for every pint of strained liquid. Simmer on low until it has set (thickened). Store in a sterilized glass jar for blackberry jam.
forageables.name: Blackberry

forageables.recipe: Roll: Marinate sliced mushrooms in lemon juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, old bay, and dried seaweed. Serve with lettuce and desired condiments on a toasted or steamed roll for a lobster-free lobster roll.
forageables.name: Lobster Mushroom

forageables.recipe: : Marinate and sautee Maitake mushrooms, aka Hen of the Woods, in your favorite oil with salt, pepper, and herbs to taste. Use in any of your favorite chicken or mushroom dishes.
forageables.name: Hen of the Woods

forageables.recipe: Sautee: Sautee in olive oil with salt, pepper and your favorite herbs.  Eat alone, or add them to your favorite pasta, rice, egg or veggie dishes.
forageables.name: Chanterelle
Morel
forageables.recipe: Spring Pasta: Toss linguini with a rich sauce of sauteed morels, ramps (or leeks), peas and cream. Top with shaved Parmesan cheese, if you like.
